title: Portrait of Two Men Burned in the Forest Fire
creator: Barnard Studio (Wallace, Idaho)
description: Posed studio portrait of two men. Both are wrapped in bandages. The man on the left has a large bandage on his head under his hat, and his face exhibits peeling. The man on the right has a similar injury, and also has both of his hands wrapped in gauze. l-r: Mr. Zeller, Anton Canjar. 5 x 7 black and white glass negative.
subject: group portraits; commercial portraiture; fire (physical concept); fire damage; fires (events)
source: PG 8, Barnard-Stockbridge Collection, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives

title: Operative report for Larson & Greenough, November 26, 1900
creator: Thiel Detective Service Co.
description: Typed report from an undercover operative mentions men traveling to find work, trouble with the deputies, union members' activities, the Mullan Hotel, and a list of 7 union members.
subject: labor disputes; labor unions; miners
source: MG 5, Stanly Easton. Papers, 1900-1916, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives

title: Labor building on Bank Street, Wallace
creator: Tabor's Photo Service, Wallace Idaho
description: The Labor building on Bank Street in Wallace, Idaho. Two cars are parked in front of the building.
subject: employment agencies; buildings (structures)

title: Possible Funeral for a mining accident that killed 10 people after a cable broke, Mullan, Idaho
creator: Tabor's Photo Service, Wallace Idaho
description: People gather after a mining accident that killed 10 people at Morning Mine. Large bags, containing the bodies of the dead, are being brought out. Machinery and buildings can be seen in the background.
subject: accidents; mining; funeral processions; miners

title: Man standing next to Coeur d'Alene Mining District Mine Rescue Car
creator: Tabor's Photo Service, Wallace Idaho
description: A man stands next to a Coeur d'Alene Mining District Mine Rescue Car. The text on the automobile also reads "Wallace Idaho 1939."
subject: automobiles; mines

title: Pollution of the Coeur d'Alene River and adjacent waters by mine wastes
creator: Ellis, M. M.
description: A report from US Interior Fisheries Investigations to investigate toxic pollution impacting property along Coeur d'Alene river, prompted by complaints by residents about damage to land and animals.
subject: mine wastes; water pollution; heavy metals
source: Idaho Waters Digital Library, University of Idaho Library, https://www.lib.uidaho.edu/digital/iwdl/docs/iwdl-cda_ellis_1932.html

title: Map showing geological formations and mineral lands near the Northern Pacific Railroad in northern Idaho and Washington Territories
creator: Rinkseeker, D. G.; Tiernan, J. M.
description: Map of geological formations and mineral lands near Northern Pacific Railroad in northern Idaho and Washington. Includes Spokane, Pend D'Oreille River and Lake and Lake Coeur D'Alene. 1 in. to 4 miles 1 ms. map: col. ; 87 x 77 cm.
subject: mineral maps; geology
source: Idaho Historical Maps Collection, University of Idaho Library, https://www.lib.uidaho.edu/digital/historicalmaps/items/spec_hm5.html

title: Mountain Consolidated Mine 550 ft. level East [no. 1242]
creator: Watkins, Carleton E.
description: Two miners posed in underground mine, showing ore after blasting. Mt Con mine was in Butte Montana. Carlton Watkins took images underground to show the different depths of the mine.
subject: Butte (Mont.); mining; Anaconda Company; ore
source: PG 89, University of Idaho Library Special Collections & Archives, https://www.lib.uidaho.edu/digital/watkins/items/watkins76.html

title: Operative report, February 22, 1901
creator: Thiel Detective Service Co.
description: Operative reports some men are angry over the men from out of town getting work, miners are working under assumed names, a rumor that some mine employees are frustrated with the system.
subject: labor disputes; murder; undercover; miners
source: MG 5, Stanly Easton. Papers, 1900-1916, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, https://www.lib.uidaho.edu/digital/bunkerhill/items/bunkerhill412.html
